posts.text:
Waymo should be held liable for failing to automate a minimal "don't make the problem worse" (e.g. pulling over) response to a citywide crisis.

Imagine if this were an emergency necessitating large scale evacuations. San Francisco is due for a 100-year earthquake, and CA spent last summer on fire.

Something I think is particularly interesting about this is that even though it's probably right: the notion of a modern LM with a hidden dim of 42 is ridiculous. Given that we need orders of magnitude more representational dimensions to do useful things rn, that suggests an inefficiency somewhere.
